alert_bridge=Bridge mode requires at least 2 network cards!
alert_mirrors_for_feedback=<span class="hot"> When binding multiple mirror ports, the default return port is at the mirror port. It is detected that you have bound the return port and it is recommended to delete it! </span> Confirm to delete?
alert_bind_mirrors=<span class="hot">In the multi-mirror collection environment, the separate hits must be forwarded by the switch. </span>Confirm to continue?
skip=ignore

desc_nicbind=1. NIC-WAN: If you use a separate external line to access the Internet, you need to add a WAN. <br> 2. NIC-LAN: generally do not bind this port, in a multi-machine cluster, using the LAN as a disk communication port.

normal=Normal
tip_hit_ip=Web management address, modify this IP needs to restart the system
tip_gateway=Please set the router's IP address. If you use NIC-HIT to access the Internet, it is required.
get_gateway_mac=Get current gateway MAC
tip_vlanid=Range 2~4095, used only when the switch disables VLAN 1. If 0 is disabled, double-layer QINQ VLAN is represented in x.y format.
tip2_vlanid=Range 2~4095, only used when the switch disables VLAN 1. 0 means not enabled
show_pro_settings=Show advanced settings...
confirm_vlanid=<span class="hot">You set the VLAN ID to: <span class="color4">{0}</span>, which may prevent you from accessing Web Administration (you can enter console settings). If you do not know the operation, please do not arbitrarily modify it. <br>Confirm the modification of VLAN ID? </span>
warn_ip_range=<span class="hot">Warning: To prevent conflicts with the secondary route IP, it is recommended not to set the hit port to the 192.168.0.0/24 network segment. </span><br>I understand and need to set!
change_ip=Change IP

desc_network_mirror=1. Same route: The packet return data reaches the user directly through the switch (usually a Layer 2 environment). <br>2. Cross-route: Packet data is forwarded to the user through the gateway (usually a three-tier environment). Forwarding is determined by the static routing table. <br>3. Mirroring traffic replication: copy the mirrored traffic to a specified network card at the same time, and the received network card can be multiple. <a class="link need-reload" href="{0}">Click here to view Mirror traffic</a>.
td_net_topology_type=Network topology type:
td_net_option=Network options:
td_mirror_copy=Mirror traffic copy:
td_is_active=Activate:
desc_same_route=Same route<span class="mark">(user network and the same router as this machine)</span>
desc_cross_route=Cross route <span class="mark">(User network and local machine are not in the same routing area, independent BRAS system, and there is no NAT on BRAS)</span>
desc_has_pppoe=Whether to join the PPPoE layer <span class="mark">(Force the PPPoE data layer when back package)</span>
desc_has_vlan=Whether to join the VLAN layer <span class="mark">(Force the VLAN data layer when adding packets)</span>
actived=Activated
unactive=Unactivated
name=Name
nic=NIC
topology_type=Topology type
in_pppoe=Add to PPPoE
in_vlan=Add to VLan
vlanid=VLAN ID
mirror_copy=Mirror traffic copy
is_active=Is active
same_route=Same route
cross_route=Cross route

sent_byte=Send bytes

err_pkt=Error packets

stop_pppoe=Stop dialing
h3_pppoe_log=#Dial log
desc_network_pppoe=Description: allows the caching system to connect to the PPPoE server through dial-up networking. This applies only when the intranet is a pure PPPoE dial-up connection. In addition, you need to assign a fixed IP for cached dialing on the PPPoE server and set the preferred DNS assigned to the PPPoE client to this IP.
h3_params_config=#Settings
td_ppp_username=Dial user name:
td_ppp_password=Dial password:
td_ppp_service_name=PPPoE service name:
td_ppp_option=Dial configuration:
tip_ppp_password=Please leave blank if you do not change your password
tip_ppp_service_name=Please leave blank if there is no service name
ppp_option1=Modify the system default route after successful dialing
ppp_option2=Automatically start dialing
ppp_option3=Enable debug
ppp_option4=Specify the PPPoE service name

tip_uplimit=0 means unlimited
tip_downlimit=0 means unlimited

This system supports NAS network disks, and local disks are not required. <span class="hot"> After enabling or disabling the NAS network disk, please save and activate! </span>

cpu_io_chart=CPU Disk IO Load Graph
cpu_io_in_percent==CPU Disk IO Ratio (%)

mem_chart=Memory Usage Graph

sys_avg_load_chart=System Average Load Graph
avg_load=Average load
desc_sys_avg_load=1. Average load is a comprehensive indicator of system pressure. Usually, a load greater than 5 indicates a high load, 1 to 5 medium, or less than 1 light, and an average load under normal conditions should be less than 2. <br>2. Disk IO is a part of the CPU load. If the long term is greater than 30%, it indicates that the system has abnormal read/write operations to the disk, or the disk itself has a problem.

loading_data_by_date=Loading {0} data, please wait...

io_used=Disk IO Usage

MX record: mail routing record, this record is used to set the mail server to point to <br>3. CNAME record: Alias ​​record, this record allows you to map multiple names to the same computer

desc_rweb=1. Remote Web Assistance allows you to perform port mapping without the direct public IP address and port mapping on the upper-level routers, enabling users on other Internets to access Web management. <br>2. Specify the cloud login ID to keep the login address fixed. It consists of letters, numbers, and minus signs (-). The beginning and end must be letters or numbers, and the length between 4-24 characters.

desc_live_source=1. This system supports HTTP, UDP, RTP, RTSP, RTMP format source, support unicast output or multicast output (non-shared source), support Live-Record (non-carousel). <br>2. Review function requires hard disk support <span class="need-admin">,<a class="link" href="{0}">Click here to configure storage disk</a></span> . The size of the occupied hard disk depends on the live source stream. Taking 8 Mbps as an example, each channel needs about 80 G per day. <br> 3. The intranet web player only supports H.264+AAC encoding source, it is recommended to use APP or PC player, <a class="link" target="_blank" href="{1}">click to download APP and PC player</a></span>.
desc_live_source_no_record=1. This system supports HTTP, UDP, RTP, RTSP, RTMP format source, support unicast output or multicast output (non-shared source). <br>2. The intranet web player only supports H.264+AAC encoding source, it is recommended to use APP or PC player player<span class="only-mq">, <a class="link" target="_blank" href="{1}">click to download APP and PC player</a></span>.

desc_live_multicast=1. You only need to configure here when the multicast source address is the same but the port is different. In other cases, you can directly add and select the corresponding receiving device in the channel management. <br>2. Try not to add, edit, or delete multicast sources in the operating state, as this may result in no data in all channels.

desc_vod_upload_mgr=The local video function requires hard disk support <span class="need-admin">, <a class="link" href="{0}">click to set storage disk</a></span>. Carousel data is recommended to be placed in a two-level directory below the root directory, such as: <span class="blue">root directory\carousel\carousel1</span>. <span class="hot">Carousel only supports H.264+AAC encoded mp4 files</span>。
desc_vod_settings=This system supports local video management through samba share. You can enter <span class="hot">\\local IP</span> (such as: <span class="hot">\\192.168.1.250</span>) in the resource manager or running, and then Enter the password to enter, <a class="link" href="images/demo/open-share.png" target="_blank">click to view the example</a>.
desc_vod_list=The web player only supports H.264+AAC encoded mp4 files. APP supports most common formats (depending on the hardware decoding capabilities), such as mp4, mkv, rmvb, avi, etc.

desc_live_user=1. Please add user groups and select the corresponding channel. The user group ID length is 5, such as <span class="green">10000</span>; the user ID length is 6, such as <span class="color4">100001</span>. <br>2. APP login name equals user group ID + user ID. For example: if the user group ID is <span class="green">10000</span> and the user ID is <span class="color4">100001</span>, the login user name is <span class="green"> 10000</span><span class="color4">100001</span><br>3. The default user account is (<span class="green">10000</span><span class="color4">100001 </span>) If the system detects that the default account does not exist, it will automatically create a default account. If you do not want to enable this account, you can disable it.

For unset user groups, the first desktop is returned by default. <br>2. <span class="hot">Please first goto <a class="link need-reload" href="{1}">APP Upload Management</a> and <a class="link need- Reload" href="{2}">Image Upload Management</a> Upload related apps and images</span>, then select pictures and configure apps here. desc_app_ac_mgr=1. WiFi name does not exceed 16 characters, with the opening of the WiFi prefix, the name will automatically add room number.<br>2. WiFi password length of 8-32 digits, @ indicates a random password, empty means no password.

wifi_passwd=WiFi password
wifi_state=Enable wifi

desc_app_upgrade_wlist=1. <span class="hot">If the upgrade allowlist is enabled, only devices in the allowlist will receive the upgrade, blocklist priority is higher than allowlist</span>. <br>2. Allowlist support IP (<span class="mark">192.168.1.100</span>), IP segment (<span class="mark">192.168.1.100-192.168.2.100</span>) , MAC (<span class="mark">aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff</span>), live account (<span class="mark">10000100001</span>), 1 per line rule.
enable_upgrade_wlist=Enable allowlist
upgrade_wlist_rules=Rule list
tip_upgrade_wlist_hotel=If the hotel is checked, all equipment at the hotel will receive the update.

desc_app_upgrade_blist=1. <span class="hot">If the upgrade blocklist is enabled, devices in the blocklist will not receive the upgrade, blocklist priority is higher than allowlist</span>. <br>2. Blocklist support IP (<span class="mark">192.168.1.100</span>), IP segment (<span class="mark">192.168.1.100-192.168.2.100</span>) , MAC (<span class="mark">aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff</span>), live account (<span class="mark">10000100001</span>), 1 per line rule.
enable_upgrade_blist=Enable blocklist
upgrade_blist_rules=Rule list
tip_upgrade_blist_hotel=If the hotel is checked, all equipment at the hotel will not receive the update.

export_backup_types=Item to export
select_export_backup_types=Please select the item to export
